NO_MEDICATIONS.title: General Menopause Management
actions: Consider lifestyle modifications: regular exercise, healthy diet, stress management
Evaluate symptom severity and impact on quality of life
Discuss treatment options: hormonal vs. non-hormonal approaches
Consider baseline assessments: mammography, bone density, cardiovascular risk
alternatives: Cognitive behavioral therapy for hot flashes
Dietary modifications: limit caffeine, alcohol, spicy foods
monitoring: Follow-up in 3 months to reassess symptoms

HRT_ONLY.title: Hormone Replacement Therapy Plan
actions: Initiate low-dose estrogen therapy with appropriate progestogen if uterus intact
Consider transdermal route if cardiovascular risk factors present
Schedule baseline investigations: mammography, cervical screening
alternatives: Non-hormonal options: SSRIs/SNRIs for vasomotor symptoms
Vaginal estrogen for genitourinary symptoms only
Gabapentin for hot flashes if HRT contraindicated
monitoring: Clinical review at 3 months, then 6 months, then annually
Monitor for side effects and symptom improvement

MIXED_MEDICATIONS.title: Complex Medication Management
actions: Review all current medications for interactions
Implement gradual introduction of new therapies
alternatives: Alternative medication classes with fewer interactions
monitoring: Monitor for drug interactions and side effects
